content.description: a long arete/ridge climb that requires you to hop, skip, or jump to the next formation. If you're tall, you can basically just step into the next formation. A mix between bolts and gear. Walk off.
content.location: The thin arete/ridge just as you enter the Grotto. Look for the bolts.

content.description:
Just to the left of Caravan.  Start in the chimney and follow the bolts onto the face.  Mostly 5.7-5.9 with one 5.10 face move by the second bolt.  Cams to #2 and slings for extension.

 It's possible to start this climb from the ledge above and to the left of the chimney (required if using a short rope to TR).

 Var - instead of climbing the chimney, face climb past the first bolt and through the weird square xenolith. This is a more challenging (~5.9) start. Rejoin the climb above the chimney.
content.protection: 3 bolts and cams to #2 BD, shares anchor (rappel hangers) with Caravan. Another bolt is found on the optional lower slab start, plus one more if finishing on the last slabby crux of Caravan.

content.description: Climb the rounded dome like feature starting on steep face climbing (crux #1) past 3 bolts. Gear placements are possible as you climb up past horizontal features passing another bolt to a final "headwall". A final high bolt protects the finishing crux moves. A rappel anchor is above at a ledge stance.
content.protection: Gear to #3 cam a lot and 5 bolts.

content.description: This is a great climbing area in a small canyon like feature along The Grotto trail just before entering a cool tunnel of boulders. The Caravan Dome is the large primary feature. Hop Skip and a Jump is the interesting low angled spire to its left.
